definition: to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳

sentences.english: I usually felt two ear quilts the talking of person the voice the earthquakeed.
sentences.chinese: 我经常感到两只耳朵被人的说话声震聋了。

sentences.english: The pounding of the machines deafened them.
sentences.chinese: 机器的重击声把他们震聋了。

sentences.english: It was so noisy that my ears were tingling.
I thought I would lose my hearing .
sentences.chinese: 我想我的耳朵都要震聋了。

sentences.english: We were almost deafened by the explosion.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸声几乎把我们的耳朵震聋。

sentences.english: Her voice kept rising, as if working its way out of the human ear.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音越来越高，好像要把人的耳朵震聋似的。

sentences.english: Don't make such a harsh noise. My ears are tingling .
sentences.chinese: 别这样刺耳地吵，我都震聋了。

sentences.english: We're being deafened by next door's stereo.
sentences.chinese: 隔壁的立体声音响要把我们耳朵震聋。

definition: to knock out (of a jolt from an earthquake or crash)
to wake sb up with a noise
loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
to wail like ghosts and howl like wolves (idiom)
